sense.def: Pathological Condition of chuang 瘡 , sores, conditions forming clusters of blisters on the chest, flanks and lower back with an excruciatingly piercing pain, accompanied bystrong heat and an aversion to cold, as a major sign. This condition is reminiscent of the neurological disease herpes zoster. Formerly it was believed that the urine of earwigs, when touched by the shadow of a human, would cause this person to suffer from this disease. Zhu bing yuan hou lun 諸病源候論 25: 其成瘡，初如豆粒黑子，或如火燒，或 如蠼螋尿瘡 , “When this develops into sores it appears first as black moles like beans. Or like a burning. Or like earwig-urine sores ”. Qu tu 取吐 , to stimulate vomiting [91]
Alternative Names tan tu 探吐.

Therapeutic Approach using pharmaceutical substances or other means to stimulate vomiting to cure accumulations of pathological matter, such as phlegmy sputum, liquids, undigested food, toxic qi, or toxic matter, in the upper part of the body. Zhou hou bei ji fang 肘後備急方 2: Recipe Entry chi san 赤散：以少許納鼻中，吸之，取吐 , “A small amount inhaled through the nose will stimulate vomiting ”.
